alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 7:48AM PST until January 14 at 8:43AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Snohomish River At Snohomish affecting Snohomish County. .Heavy rain over the Central Cascades will come to an end this afternoon. Rainfall for the event will end up in the 4 to 6 inch range in the Central Cascades. The Snohomish River at Snohomish will rise today and reach flood stage this afternoon. The river will crest later tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snohomish River At Snohomish. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, the Snohomish River will flood several roads...including the Snohomish-Monroe highway...and low areas of the lower Snohomish valley that are not protected by levees. A stage of 27 feet on the Snohomish River corresponds roughly to a Phase 2 in the Snohomish County flood program. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 20.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this afternoon cresting near 27.4 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 345 PM PST.
